Posted By: Kryptnyt (4/1/2011 5:44:51 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
A great card. Forcing horrible choices upon your opponent turn after turn is good enough in itself, but once you combine this with the other cards traditionally played with the Stack - mana acceleration, tangle wires, and Trinispheres and Spheres of Resistance, those horrible choices are no longer horrible : they are pure despair.  
  
An elegant card, which requires skill to utilize, and rewards it greatly.
posts.html:
A great card. Forcing horrible choices upon your opponent turn after turn is good enough in itself, but once you combine this with the other cards traditionally played with the Stack - mana acceleration, tangle wires, and Trinispheres and Spheres of Resistance, those horrible choices are no longer horrible : they are pure despair.

An elegant card, which requires skill to utilize, and rewards it greatly.

posts.post_content: Love this in the Land.dec, play the Stax and use exploration or mana bond to get a lot of lands out. Replay them with either Crucible of Worlds or Life from the Loam. Before you get the stax out, you can stall the game with wastelands, maze of iths, rishadan ports, and maybe trinisphere or other game slowers.

posts.post_content:
Combos surprisingly well with [Chimney Imp](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chimney Imp). Stuff them in a deck full of [Soul Foundries](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=46723) and some myr ([Sire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=213734), [Perilous](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=194056), [Retriever](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=46126), and [Servitor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=50179) perhaps), not forgetting your [Sundial](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=228118), and you've got a nice little deck.  
  
  
Edit:  
This deck rapes.
posts.html:
Combos surprisingly well with Chimney Imp. Stuff them in a deck full of Soul Foundries and some myr (Sire, Perilous, Retriever, and Servitor perhaps), not forgetting your Sundial, and you've got a nice little deck.


Edit:
This deck rapes.

Posted By: BastianQoU (3/3/2012 5:38:28 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
@ BegleOne  
  
You should add [Sundial of the Infinite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Sundial of the Infinite) to the list, with the added bonus of being able to put a soot counter on it during your turn without letting the sacrifice trigger resolve. And if you don't have a [Smokestack](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Smokestack), you can always drop a [Phyrexian Dreadnought](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Phyrexian Dreadnought) third turn.  
  
Once your opponent has no permanents and after you've dropped an [Eater of Days](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eater of Days) or two, you could [Hex Parasite](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hex Parasite) the Stack down to one counter during your upkeep and then sack it to itself. Or [Shrapnel Blast](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Shrapnel Blast); that's pretty good too.  
  
  
For a **much** more awkward (but therefore equally more awesome) combo: combine the Stack with [Teferi's Curse](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Teferi's Curse), [March of the Machines](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=March of the Machines), and [Time and Tide](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Time and Tide) on an [Isochron Scepter](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Isochron Scepter)/[Panoptic Mirror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Panoptic Mirror)/whatever will let you cast it on each of your turns. Jus... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
@ BegleOne

You should add Sundial of the Infinite to the list, with the added bonus of being able to put a soot counter on it during your turn without letting the sacrifice trigger resolve. And if you don't have a Smokestack, you can always drop a Phyrexian Dreadnought third turn.

Once your opponent has no permanents and after you've dropped an Eater of Days or two, you could Hex Parasite the Stack down to one counter during your upkeep and then sack it to itself. Or Shrapnel Blast; that's pretty good too.


For a much more awkward (but therefore equally more awesome) combo: combine the Stack with Teferi's Curse, March of the Machines, and Time and Tide on an Isochron Scepter/Panoptic Mirror/whatever will let you cast it on each of your turns. Jus... (see all)

posts.post_content: I use it with enchantments like [Rancor](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Rancor) which I can play again after sacrificing. Also, you can choose to sacrifice permanents first before putting another soot counter on. On your first upkeep, you sacrifice nothing then put the soot counter on. On your opponent's upkeep, he has to sacrifice the first permanent.
posts.html:
